instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936-B wrong serial numbers
threads.message:
MBP 13 Early 2011 with different serial numbers in BIOS and motherboard sticker. 

Would it be possible that someone links me a clean BIOS with a specific serial number? I'd like to match BIOS with a sticker.

Thanks

threads.title: 820-2936-B wrong serial numbers
threads.message:
So the BIOS chip was reflashed?
Or motherboard sticker changed?
What about the serial number from the back cover?

threads.title: 820-2936-B wrong serial numbers
threads.message:
Unfortunately, all of them are difference: back cover, motherboard (sticker is on the other side) and BIOS.
Macbook was EFI locked, I've unlocked it, but haven't cleaned ME region.

threads.title: 820-2936-B wrong serial numbers
threads.message:
Software unlock doesn't touch ME region, nor serial.
I suppose you flashed completely new dump, from other machine...
Unlock the backup and reflash it correctly.

threads.title: 820-2936-B wrong serial numbers
threads.message:
Yes, I flashed new dump from Internet.

How do I unlock the old dump?

threads.title: 820-2936-B wrong serial numbers
threads.message: Post it here, maybe someone will do it...

threads.title: 820-2936-B wrong serial numbers
threads.message: I can do that, but I'd like to learn it too, that way it's faster, rather than posting every time and waiting.
